title: ARIMA
description: Anomoly detector using ARIMA estimation and (default: euclidean) distance function to calculate prediction error as anomaly score

parameters.name: window_size
parameters.description: Size of sliding window (also used as prediction window size)

parameters.name: max_lag
parameters.description: Number of points, after which the ARIMA model is re-fitted to the data to deal with trends and shifts

parameters.name: p_start
parameters.description: Minimum AR-order for the auto-ARIMA process

parameters.name: q_start
parameters.description: Minimum MA-order for the auto-ARIMA process

parameters.name: max_p
parameters.description: Maximum AR-order for the auto-ARIMA process

parameters.name: max_q
parameters.description: Maximum MA-order for the auto-ARIMA process

parameters.name: differencing_degree
parameters.description: Differencing degree for the auto-ARIMA process

parameters.name: distance_metric
parameters.description: Distance measure used to calculate the prediction error = anomaly score

parameters.name: random_state
parameters.description: Seed for the random number generator
